results.title: Crossroads. Eight miles high
results.creator_credit: BBC, WGBH (Boston), High Thomson, Karen Walsh, Alan Lewens and Mick Conefrey
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Dancing in the street: a rock and roll history”.
The Blues crosses the Atlantic and reaches Britain where it finds a new direction. Groups like the Beatles and the Rolling Stones invade America and somewhere in the process Heavy Metal is invented. In this episode entitled ‘Crossroads’, interviews and performances by legendary musicians such as The Rolling Stones, Eric Clapton, Jeff Beck are featured. In the second program ‘Eight miles high’ the whole phenomenon of Psychadelia is explored, including interviews and clips from The Grateful Dead, Janis Joplin and Pink Floyd. This episode captures a landmark era in the development of rock music in the 1960’s.

results.title: Crossroads Rock Concert
results.creator_credit: Salvation Army, Salvation Army. Australia Southern Territory and Richard Hodder
results.brief_description: Three Christian rock groups gig together in aid of Salvation Army’s Crossroads Program for Homeless Youth, interspersed with modern parables about being young and different from the crowd. “Crossroads” is a video about, and for, contemporary Christian youth.

results.title: Crossroads of life
results.creator_credit: United Nations. Dept. of Public Information and Henri Storck
results.brief_description: Hihglights several cases of children with serious problems, who are helped to understand their needs and become healthier people. After becoming delinquent, they are treated in a children’s institution. Scenes show therapeutic work to help them relieve aggressive feelings. International cooperation to improve methods of prevention, observation and treatment of delinquency is urged.

results.title: Crossroads
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Mark Carliner and Walter Hill
results.brief_description: Long ago, Willie Brown bargained his soul with the Devil at the crossroads in return for fame. Gifted young guitarist Eugene (Ralph Maccio) will do anything to play the blues like his legendary hero and travels across country where he meets the now old and cantankerous Willie. Together they journey to the fated crossroads and Eugene learns that to really play the blues, you must live them first. Joe Seneca and Jami Gertz also star in this production which features an incredible soundtrack by Ry Cooder.

results.title: Crossing the Great Sagrada
results.creator_credit: Priceless Pictures, All-Britisch Productions, Adrian Brunel and Lionel Rich
results.brief_description: In 1924, during one of the periodic slumps in the British film industry, Adrian Brunel amused himself and many others by producing a series of burlesques. This film tells of Holmes, Sweet and Holmes’ voyage by sea to Africa where they then set off, on camels, across the desert to finally arrive at the famous Cascara of Sagrada falls. A comic travel film of the silent era.

results.title: Crossing borders
results.creator_credit: Film Project for Women's History and Future, Linda Balek, Barbara Laing and Jeanne Kracher
results.brief_description: The story of the Women’s International League for Peace and Freedom, the longest standing organisation of its kind. Begun during the first World War and still alive all around the world, the WILPF is a testament to women’s historic resistance to militarism and oppression. Despite their important place in history, the WILPF’s study has, until now, remained buried. “Crossing Borders” uncovers this dramatic and forgotten chapter in history.

results.title: Crosses
results.brief_description: A documentary that examines the experiences of Australian soldiers fighting in the Middle East and at Gallipoli during World War 1, between 1914-1918. Archival film footage shows the conditions on the battlefields, and ex-soldiers recount their experiences.

results.title: Crossbanding and jointing veneers
results.creator_credit: K. Baron Hartley and Topical Film Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic woodwork”.
Both sides of the wood are veneered to prevent warping. The method of making this is demonstrated through an example of a door made of laminated wood. It is explained how to veneer the face of the door to match the edges and when a piece of veneer is not wide enough to cover a surface, how a joint must be made.

results.title: Cross your heart and hope to live
results.creator_credit: Danish Heart Foundation and Bert Christensen
results.brief_description: Looks at the rising incidence of heart disease in Western society. Of babies born with perfect arteries, by the age of 15 virtually everybody has ruined them to some extent. Points out that the “good life” is responsible - smoking, lack of physical activity, excess fatty substances in the blood, high blood pressure and overweight are to blame. Suggestions are made for overcoming the problem.
